alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 7:10AM EDT until May 05 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Hampshire, including the following areas, Northern Carroll, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll and Southern Grafton. * WHEN...From Noon EDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Low pressure will move northward today and spread heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms into the White Mountains, especially this afternoon and early evening. A few locations may receive over an inch of rain which will aggravate current flooding problems. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton
